website_summaries.verdict: An effective plunger that comes in attractive canister.
pros: Can be stored in the bathroom without being an eyesore
Holes in canister bottom let it dry without getting water on the floor
Extra-long handle keeps you well away from toilet water
cons: Strong rubber scent that comes from the use of natural rather than synthetic rubber

customer_reviews.title: Product material stinks!
customer_reviews.text: I'm bummed about this purchase. The plunger itself is great quality, and I like the holder it's in. But the chemical stink from the material is unbearable - I can smell it several feet outside our guest bath at times. I bought two, somehow missing other reviews that mentioned this, so I basically threw $40+ in the trash. Oddly, they didn't smell too bad for me at first, but now that the stench is spreading, I'm past the return window. Big disappointment from a brand that I've otherwise had good experiences with. But it's now making me question the materials they use in all their items. Oxo, please fix this problem!
customer_reviews.author: Beth L.

customer_reviews.title: Stinks worse than the clogs it would be used for
customer_reviews.text: Even in the plastic, I could smell this item from outside the box. It filled the entire apartment with a burned rubber smell that was hard to remove. I actually had to put this item in my shower and rinse it to try and remove the stench (with little effect) so now it sits in hiding in the fat closet and I’m afraid for the day I have to use it
customer_reviews.author: Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Stinks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Stinks!!! If you like the fresh rubber scent of a tire warehouse in your bathroom, then this is the plunger for you. And as a bonus, the stench doesn't dissipate, so you get your money's worth of odor for nearly an eternity!
customer_reviews.author: Haynes

customer_reviews.title: I used twice and the rubber ripped in two places ...
customer_reviews.text: I used twice and the rubber ripped in two places. This is the second one I've had and first one ripped as well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: It really works, all of it😃
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my home, and the plunger works as a plunger should. That is enough discussion of that......... The coolest part is the holder. I like having a plunger at the ready for those moments when it is necessary, but prefer not to set them directly on the floor, nor do I want to see them so the holder is perfect. As I lift the weight of the plunger up the caddy opens and stays open until I place the plunger back in, then it closes an my plunger is out of sight. Yay!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill P.

customer_reviews.title: Rubber doesn't spring back after 10 uses - poop water shoots everywhere
customer_reviews.text: The rubber portion that collapses wore down after about 10 uses. For every downward plunge, you have to take 5-10 seconds to uncollapse the rubber by pulling against the side of the toilet bowl. The collapsed rubber then springs back into place while simultaneously turning poop and its watery friends into projectiles launching them directly at the handle and undoubtedly at your nice new work trousers. As much as one should wear clothing frying bacon, I'd recommend not wearing clothing using this plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This plunger does not work at all. The rubber stays collapsed every time you plunge. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: We've owned two of these plungers. We liked the fact that they could sit in the bathroom in their clamshell and be relatively unobtrusive. The first one we had worked well, so we added another for the second floor bathroom. The second one just never seemed to work very well (it seemed to seal, but it would 'collapse' and not expand again), so it ended up in the trash. Today, our first one gave up on us. The rubber broke down and separated where the rubber cup meets the shaft, and the shaft pushed right through the cup. Two is enough, we are moving on to a more durable design...
customer_reviews.author: BDH

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these for my work and just needed to use one for the first time. My first plunge into the toilet and the rubber flipped backwards and is stuck. I have to grab a stick and force it back into it's normal position. Every time I plunge, there is zero suction. It only pushes the plunger inside out and I have to force it back. All 4 of them have this same issue. These are pretty worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Boyd

customer_reviews.title: This one works!
customer_reviews.text: I was ready to give up and pay a plumber $100 or more to clear a stubborn clog when I read reviews of this product. Despite many complaints of a terrible odor emitted by the rubber plunger head, I ordered it. There virtually is no odor at all, and the clog was cleared rapidly with very little effort. I ordered another one for a second bathroom. Another great OXO product, and one can order five of these plungers for the cost of one plumber visit.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: but this one is a definite whopping disappointment. The rubber material of the plunger smells abominably
customer_reviews.text: I favor OXO products generally, but this one is a definite whopping disappointment. The rubber material of the plunger smells abominably. I could go on, but I'm trying to restrain myself. It's truly horrible. I've had it outside for over a week now, hoping the smell would dissipate...it still smells, so I'll keep it outside for now. I'd return it, but uncharacteristically for me, I threw away the labels and packing material upon receipt of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Broke After 12 Uses
customer_reviews.text: OXO! So disappointed. I have many of your items! OXO means quality to me, but unfortunately only after 12 uses in the past 6 months...and the supple rubber tears at the connection of the pole. Also... quite annoying that the flange would collapse during use making it hard to suction, and I'd have to pull the flange back out before I could put it in its lovely holder. I do love the modern design that I expect from OXO. Unfortunately today, I had to buy an old school ugly ol orange and wood plunger that'll do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Lara

customer_reviews.title: The best plunger on the market!
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion, this is the best plunger on the market. I had one I purchased years ago and it has worked consistently with no issues. I recently bought this one so there would be a plunger available in both of our bathrooms. Again, no issues at all. The design is well thought out and looks fine to keep out in the bathroom - in other words, it doesn't clash with the decor. It has a sleek, modern look and I cannot say enough about how it performs when needed.
customer_reviews.author: cctyger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Plunger
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the prolific reviewer that I should be considering how many things I buy from Amazon. I’ve written less than 5 I can remember in the past decade. This product deserved a review. This plunger is Oxo’s design work at its finest. Lately I’ve felt like their products don’t live up the genius of their earlier work. Not only is the easiest plunger I’ve ever used but holder has been designed to eliminate the problems that plague lesser imitators. Buy this plunger and you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Liebman

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work at all. Plunges down and the rubber flips inside out. You then have to use your hands to flip the black rubber back into position.
customer_reviews.author: gina wiltz

customer_reviews.title: Sleek, hidden well
customer_reviews.text: I think plungers are gross, but when you need them, you really need them. Enter this little find. The case stays open until you've put the plunger back in, making stowing easy. The only minor con is that it can be tough moving the case when you're trying to clean the floor because it's designed to open without the plunger, but meh. Still A+for us.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Rips
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the rubber on this plunger is terrible. The first one of these I bought ripped in a few months, and the latest one I got lasted a couple of weeks before the rubber ripped.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Birkeland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Plunger Worth Poop!
customer_reviews.text: 1-push plunger with rubber that collapses, gets stuck and splashes water everywhere. It never closes completely which makes it look extra ugly and totally useless as a bathroom accessory. And Crazy unsanitary as canister collects what plunger picks up then drips everywhere as you carry to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: So cool! Nice look
customer_reviews.text: Who would think that a plunger can actually make the bathroom look nicer?! This plumber does just that by completely closing in the plunger once it is placed in the holder. Great quality and awesome design.
customer_reviews.author: laya k.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but....  Plunger has odor
customer_reviews.text: We like the product, the design, and it is very functional for our toilets (e.g. the smaller ball of plunger fits our older toilets). However... the plunger is molded into the plastic handle and the rubber continues to "off-gas" creating a strong unpleasant odor. We had to set it outside for a week to allow some of the smell to go away. I come from a manufacturing background and off-gassing is common in many molded products, but this is exceptionally strong. I think the manufacturer could tweek its manufacturing process and reduce this level of smell. Bathrooms have enough smells with out adding new ones if you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Jim

customer_reviews.title: Better Design
customer_reviews.text: Oxo is a good brand. The design shape of the plunger is better than the traditional design. Enclosed the drain hole better and pushes water where it needs to go to get the job done. Works faster than traditional design plungers.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond V.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: This plunger actually works and isn't just taking up space in my bathroom. I don't feel embarrassed to have it sitting out by my toilet because it is covered in a container but it's still easy to get to and use. I don't know why other plungers don't come with a case for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap rubber and plastic
customer_reviews.text: The rubber part broke off within less than 15 uses and less than 4 months. The rubber part also barely kept its shape when plunging. Super poor quality even though the pictures looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Cheez42

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awful
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. This product was not able to plunge the toilet at all. It just kept getting stuck in on itself whenever anyone would try to plunge the toilet. Absolutely non-functional and poorly made. We ended up tossing out the plunger itself and keeping the cover to use with a different plunger. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: AnniebelleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does an icky job discreetly
customer_reviews.text: It is easily tucked away in a corner and its covered plunger works very well with the bell design. Creates good suction. The cover hides the tool used for an odious task in a visually pleasing way. This is the third one I have bought for each of our bathrooms. I especially like that guests don't have to be embarrassed when using the powder room and they have an "issue." They can handle themselves .
customer_reviews.author: Bowser Lady

customer_reviews.title: Not Oxo's best product
customer_reviews.text: This is the third of this product that I've had in each time the plunger get stuck in the up position when I need it most. I will never order this product again. I have a lot of products from this company and this is the one that has disappointed me the most
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Moderate plunger
customer_reviews.text: We bought 3 plungers, all of this type. One just broke - 14 months later and the other 2 are still in use. I would think that the rubber would last longer than 14 months?
customer_reviews.author: C. K.

customer_reviews.title: The stupid plungers get stuck in the down position and the rubber won't snap back
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, and both of them worked initially, and the holder is convenient, but they no longer snap back to provide any suction whatsoever. I am not inclined to want to grab the end to manually snap it back, so these are a complete failure. When you push down, it pops into place and stays that way. Pulling on it just pulls the whole plunger out with the cup still popped inwards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Solution to an Everyday Problem
customer_reviews.text: Terrific! First, it's unobtrusive--pure white, completely covers the business end of the plunger. Second, it's easy to access. Just pull up and the clamshell cover opens up and flops open. You don't touch anything but the handle. Third, it's easy to replace. The cover stays open, so you just place it back in the cover and its own weight closes the clamshell cover. If you've wanted to have a plunger in the bathroom but found it unattractive this may be the answer to your problem.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: There’s not much to say about a plunger, really, other than this is a good one. I like that when it’s in the container it looks discreet and not very noticeable next to the toilet.
customer_reviews.author: BreannaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It works. That's all you can really ask of a plunger.
customer_reviews.text: There are only so many positive things you can say about a plunger without sounding creepy so I'll be brief: It does what it's supposed to do, it's nice and sturdy, the stand is great and it hides and business end which is appreciated. It's a bit taller than I expected but I'm cool with that as it keeps me further away from the plumbing situation when in use... If you need a toilet plunger, this one will do.
customer_reviews.author: MTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great Plunger
customer_reviews.text: It does its job. I like the white case holder as well. I also bought the matching toilet brush cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive and usable.
customer_reviews.text: The toilet plunger is very sturdy and has a normal center and our rubber ring. The handles are very attractive and handy. They are white, solid, and have an easy grip knob at the top of each handle The reason I gave it a 4 is because the canister seems a little light I’m not sure how well that will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great plunger and design
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and great price. I received a couple days after I ordered it, and I think it is worth the money. The design of the holder is also very easy to use. It is so much better than just having a plunger left out in the open on the floor behind the toilet!
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower Mom

customer_reviews.title: If it works
customer_reviews.text: It really looks nice but is very, very hard to use.....very hard.......my son who is 35 years old said that it didn't work.....I did not believe him.....I just tried it this morning and he was correct it does not work ...........what a waste of money........
customer_reviews.author: Larry C

customer_reviews.title: Too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The rubber is much too flimsy and gave out in less than a year. I expected much better. I’m throwing it out and spending a little more on a decency plunger. If you only use a plunger once a year, you’re probably fine with this.
customer_reviews.author: S. Magliocco

customer_reviews.title: Very strong rubber odor that doesn’t go away
customer_reviews.text: The smell of strong rubber that emits from this plunger is sickening. I tried putting it outside for a few days hoping the smell would disipate but it’s still stinks. As soon as you walk into my bathroom you can smell it, going to have to store it out in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: JMW59

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This works perfectly with no complaints or issues at all. Did not really notice any "rubber odor" issues which others have mentioned. Very happy, as we have been with all OXO products.
customer_reviews.author: James Milson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I tend to clog my toilet very often and I've tried just about all the different styles of plungers. By far this is my favorite design. It generally unclogs things pretty quickly, and it's small enough that it doesn't slosh the water out of the toilet when it's backing up. The caddy works well and keeps this neat and tidy too. I've bought one for each bathroom in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kawidood

customer_reviews.title: I must have revived a bad plunger
customer_reviews.text: I press down on the plunger and it gets stuck in that position. It’s supposed to pop back up but mine stays collapsed. I thought after usage it would get better but nothing’s changed.
customer_reviews.author: john park

customer_reviews.title: Rubber failed one year from purchase after only a handful of uses.
customer_reviews.text: Love the concept. Looks nice and is easy to use. Unfortunately the plunger itself is cheap. Went to use it and the handle just pushed through the rubber portion - rubber tore in two places. We only actually used the thing a handful of times. I expected it to last a lot longer. Will be replacing with something else. Also unfortunate that you have to hold the bottom together in order to move the plunger from one location to another - just a function of how it releases. Wouldn't have been a deal breaker if the plunger lasted.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Item works as advertised, just wish it was available in more color choices...
customer_reviews.author: Pauln CT

customer_reviews.title: you're always really glad to have an effective one
customer_reviews.text: In situations where you need a plunger, you're always really glad to have an effective one. My last plunger would turn inside out and was surprisingly bad at doing the only thing it was designed to do. This plunger is like a dream in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: xine

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, cute, and does exactly what you need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: In terms of an affordable, effective product for making sure your bathroom toilet remains clean, look no further than this one. I recently purchased this for my new apartment and not only does it get the job done (I think you know what I mean) it's actually really cute and looks nice sitting next to the toilet, rather than an eyesore like the great majority of plungers. The canister fits the plunger perfectly, and doesn't leak anything out of it! Thank goodness!
customer_reviews.author: Gina_D

customer_reviews.title: Very nice plunger and holder
customer_reviews.text: Very nice plunger and holder. Keeps it tucked away so nicely and easy to keep clean
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Cline

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about a plunger but I must admit that you do not sacrifice quality for style!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Steiner

customer_reviews.title: nice clean look for a nasty problem :)
customer_reviews.text: hides the plunger well... stows away nicely to the back side of the toilet. Put one in every bathroom. We will see on durability as I have 2 boys... easy to clean...? Not sure if poop is ever easy to clean lol ;)
customer_reviews.author: GatorBait

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: A toilet plunger is not something you give much thought to until you actually need it! The OXO Good Grips toilet plunger simply works - with hardly any effort at all! While the rubber plunger appears a tad smaller in diameter than most plungers, the suction along with the extra long handle make the ugly task of plunging waste quick and easy. Appearance is sleek, self contained in it's matching canister and discreetly sits next to the toilet. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Allison Carlysle

customer_reviews.title: Hides messy toilet plunger
customer_reviews.text: Water evaporates after placing in holder if their is any remaining after rinsing after use, hides plunger in nicely thougt out caddy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this plunger because I like how the holder completely conceals the head of the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this plunger because I like how the holder completely conceals the head of the actual plunger, which made me feel safer to leave in the bathroom where my kitten may visit from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Thinking of replacing the other plunger I have. Didn't have at local stores, quite limited selection. Seems Ironic to leave a review for a plunger. lol It comes right out of the holder, which I was concerned about, but it seems to work really well. It seems to let the excess moister evap pretty decent. Unless you have to use a lot, like I do with my two kids learning to potty train, because they overload the toilet paper. Large ball on top handle is also convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Borden

customer_reviews.title: Great product - highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement plunger and wanted to buy a good product and this was the highest rated on Amazon. Based on my experience, Amazon reviewers have it right. The case is nice to hide the plunger and make more sanitary than sitting on floor. The plunger functions very well. Many people complained about the smell, but it's not that bad. It does have a scent, but it's not overbearing. Overall, this a great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Root

customer_reviews.title: OXO is definitely a brand to trust.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. I was concerned about the price BUT having a plunger that looks attractive enough to leave out is terrific. It is also very easy to use and the storage base is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie—the fussy one

customer_reviews.title: It is well hidden but
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work like a reg plunger, water goes all over the place, unless I am doing something wrong I miss the old plunger!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Sunther

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work all that well
customer_reviews.text: It turns itself inside out when you're plunging, so you have to wait until it pops back to the original form before you can plunge again. My plumber advised a repetitive pumping motion, which is impossible with this product. It has a nice, discreet canister....but if it doesn't work, it isn't worth much.
customer_reviews.author: AMQCS

customer_reviews.title: GREAT plunger; fits into the toilet as it should ...
customer_reviews.text: GREAT plunger; fits into the toilet as it should so it gets a good seal to do it's "job'!
customer_reviews.author: Randye

customer_reviews.title: A lumberjacks dream!
customer_reviews.text: This plunge does the job very well. I was a little worried after reading other reviews that it was not made well and the handle was not going to hold up. After getting it and using it I am happy to say that the durability is fine for the job. If your breaking this thing then you are using it wrong or you have other issues that may be better addressed with a visit to the doctor. This thing breaks up log jams like dynamite.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best plunger, ever!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately (or fortunately, depending on how you look at it) I needed to use this brand-new plunger the very day I received it. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it plunged, as my old one required a lot of muscle to operate. After the plunger had done its job, I was really appreciative of the self-opening and closing storage pod. No muss, no fuss...just how I like it!!
customer_reviews.author: Ronda Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Good plunger in attractive canister
customer_reviews.text: Good plunger and it's in an attractive canister. The most important thing about a plunger is it it works well and this one does. The second most important think is that it doesn't look horrible sitting in your bathroom - and this one looks ok sitting there. There are vents in the bottom of the canister that the plunger sits on, so the water can drain and evaporate, which is good. I haven't had it long enough to evaluate the utility of that feature, but it seems to make sense.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it's a plunger
customer_reviews.text: i was hesitant to but this because a lot of reviewers said the rubber smells and i can get really annoyed by smells. it smelled a bit at the beginning -sort of chemically. and the couple of times i used it the smell returned briefly when it got wet. but it's not that bad and it doesn't last. otherwise it works well as a plunger and the cover allows it to be decorative and not too conspicuous so it can be left out within easy reach when needed
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Reader

customer_reviews.title: It does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: What else can I say really? It's a plunger. It plunges really well and I love the storage design. Seems sturdy like it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: KCH

customer_reviews.title: it works great.
customer_reviews.text: I know that many of the reviews state that it has a strong rubber smell, but I do not believe it is overbearing and when it is in its cradle I don't even smell it at all. As far as plunging, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: M. Trent

customer_reviews.title: Hard to carry while in the holder.
customer_reviews.text: The holder of the the matching brush has a convenient "neck" so is easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: ALT

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this plunger.
customer_reviews.text: Strong, reliable, and well presented this plunger takes the cake. Unclogs toilets in seconds and has a neat house to hold the plunger to let the gross water evaporate.
customer_reviews.author: DlCK

customer_reviews.title: Great product reorder, but this one arrived broken.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a tired one that I'd had for years that worked very well, but this plunger arrived with one half of its case lying on its side in the plastic bag. I was unable to successfully attach it after many attempts, so I threw it out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth a few extra $$
customer_reviews.text: So this is a plunger with a cool little clamshell holder/storage doo hickey. Its worth every penny. No mess or paper towels or rags on the floor where I set the plunger after use. Its the fancy design with the extra bell for better sealing to the toilet. It works as advertised and doesn't look nasty or out of place in my bathroom. Considering I'll probably never, ever, buy another, its so worth $20 or so.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Cannot lift as one
customer_reviews.text: Slim and light weight. but cannot lift as one unit sides pop open immediately so if you want to move it you have to lift it by the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Sgirl

customer_reviews.title: No more trying to hide the ugly plunger
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I don't have to look at that ugly plunger anymore. Haven't actually had to use the plunger yet, but the design of this is great!
customer_reviews.author: oldbutcool

customer_reviews.title: Not a good plunger
customer_reviews.text: Never noticed a smell like the other one stars. Every time you plunge it will stay collapsed. After 6 clog events inside the house the rubber ripped rendering plunger useless now. The only good thing of this product is the self closing white plastic thing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam B Winters

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice plunger. The housing hides the plunger so it ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice plunger. The housing hides the plunger so it can be kept beside the toilet without being an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Denise A

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t fit either of our toilets. The bucket design is amazing tho. Really wish it had worked.
customer_reviews.author: Olya Mauer

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth It
customer_reviews.text: Sure, for the first two months this was a great plunger. But then it started collapsing and refusing to form a seal while in use. Friggin' drugstore plungers hold up longer than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kari M Collins

customer_reviews.title: Clean and concealed !
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly hidden and contained so there’s no mess. And we live in a REALLY old building landlord won’t replace toilets so it’s great
customer_reviews.author: Alexandrea

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great engineering feat. Delivers adequate "power? to do the job with minimal effort.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: keeps the fact that I have a plunger in an entry way bathroom discreet and is easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have purchased as I didn't want to have to haul one back and forth between two bathrooms. It works perfectly, keeps the fact that I have a plunger in an entry way bathroom discreet and is easy to clean. Really, really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: katiespace

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Looks nice and is a great way to include, but hide an otherwise unsightly plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Mb126

customer_reviews.title: Great Mechanism, no smell, high quality look and feel.
customer_reviews.text: Great mechanism. Slightly larger than I had hoped, but reasonably unobtrusive. No rubber or chemical smell in my two I purchased. Feels high quality. Spring mechanism is really nice in practice. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Baty

customer_reviews.title: Nice quailty - liked the toilet brush so took the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice quailty - liked the toilet brush so took the “plunge” 😁. Just hard to give a plunger 5 stars - haven’t used it yet but it matches the brush.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Newby

customer_reviews.title: Very Neat
customer_reviews.text: Good suction. Great design where it hides the bottom of the plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Onskie

customer_reviews.title: Good looks, but plunger is weak
customer_reviews.text: Great looking plunger and clam shell cover.. but I would give the actual plunger a C+ for usage. Worked okay for the first few times, now the rubber flips up every time when you push down. Still useable, but frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hampton

customer_reviews.title: One handed operation and no mess
customer_reviews.text: Hands free all the way. There is no messing around with this plunger. It opens when I pull up and closes nicely when returning the plunger to it. No mess.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Davis

customer_reviews.title: Love this plunger
customer_reviews.text: Love this plunger. It is very efficient and looks nice and clean and neat in the bathroom. I love how it conceals the bottom and you never have to touch anything!
customer_reviews.author: marissa d.

customer_reviews.title: A winner
customer_reviews.text: As swanky as its smaller toilet brush brother, this is a great plunger with a solid handle and a canister that keeps the ugliness out of sight. There's a good aeration system inside the canister that allows the plunger to dry, too — which means the nastiness won't fester under the bell like most plungers that are stored upright.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin C. Kite

customer_reviews.title: Nice plunger
customer_reviews.text: Works well, plunger "works" available when needed and out of sight and touch most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Country Doc

customer_reviews.title: Clean and Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: I have one toilet in the house that constantly gets clogged. This is a very nice clean design and works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: This is really big. I was really surprised. ...
customer_reviews.text: This is really big. I was really surprised. I had a similar one prior to this one and it was the right size. This one is just too long and thick.
customer_reviews.author: Han Sulu

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: GREAT plunger, we have a family member that poops bricks and this plunger is awesome, creates a good seal and works on the first or second attempt. Have not had a issue since switching to this plunger
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: The perfect plunger
customer_reviews.text: This is the best plunger on the market. Works very well to clear clogs. Base is very sturdy and conceals the plunger when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: My husband is always clogging the toilet, so we’ve gone through a few plungers.. this one is by far my favorite! Buying 3 more to have in every bathroom in the house.. just bc my husband uses every bathroom in the house..
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Barba

customer_reviews.title: Canister very handy
customer_reviews.text: Canister very smartly made so we don't have to touch it when taking the plunger out and putting back in and looks ok to stay visible next to the toilet itself. Oh and plunger works as expected obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Fabrice

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Closes up to hide the ugly part, confine the wetness, looks nice.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA S. NV

customer_reviews.title: This Hideaway Plunger Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: When the dirty jobs must get done, the OXO Good Grips Hideaway Plunger gets the job done and then stores out of sight - and off the floor, in its handy receptacle. Pulls out quickly & easily and goes back into its holder by merely inserting the plunger into the self-opening and closing holder. Mess free!
customer_reviews.author: JenEEEEEEE

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: This took forever to show up and when it did the box was pretty beat up. The company refunded the price because it took over a month to arrive which was nice of them. It looks ok in a bathroom and is very functional without being an eyesore. I little heavy and kind of hard to move around but still functional.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's worth paying a few extra bucks for an aesthetically pleasing and functional plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Take The Plunge
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I've only used it a few times but it handled the job. It looks like it will hold up for a reasonable time frame.
customer_reviews.author: BeachEd

customer_reviews.title: smooth
customer_reviews.text: very smooth and slick the way it works, and it also looks very nice too. unfortunately there's a taco bell nearby so i did already get to use the plunger several times, and it is the best plunger i've ever used, i thought it was odd the way it sticks out but it works very well this way, fast food here i come!
customer_reviews.author: com

customer_reviews.title: Not a Quality Plunger
customer_reviews.text: Not a quality item—we had this for less than year and the plunger part broke off the handle. Also, it did not have much suction. Nice idea to have the base but don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Clean and neat and readily available
customer_reviews.text: Neat as a pin and hides in plain sight. Very happy with the strong plunger.
customer_reviews.author: Gail A.

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: They flip inside out and don’t have a good suction. Bought two and had to get rid of both .
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great way to conceal my toilet brush in the bathroom
customer_reviews.text: Great way to conceal my toilet brush in the bathroom. I bought a second one for my second bathroom
customer_reviews.author: Jen

product_meta.title: OXO Good Grips Hideaway Toilet Plunger and Canister
product_meta.description: Style Name:PlungerThe perfect companion to our toilet brush, the oxo good grips toilet plunger features an elegant canister for storage within easy reach. Simply lift the plunger and the canister automatically springs open. The plunger head is designed to work on all toilets, including low flush. The handle design features a flat surface that is perfect for plunging. After use, simply replace the plunger in the canister for neat and sanitary storage; a built-in drip tray in the canister bottom catches excess water and allows it to quickly evaporate. Available in white or putty.
feature_bullets: The Hideaway Toilet Plunger & Canister Set is easy to tuck away unobtrusively in the bathroom. Covered Canister prevents Plunger from touching other household objects when stored in a closet or cabinet.
Canister springs open automatically when toilet plunger is lifted and neatly stores plunger when not in use
Plunger head works on all toilets, including low flush and features a smooth, ridge-free design for cleanliness
Handle features flat top surface for a secure, comfortable grip
Canister drip tray features ventilation slots that allow water to quickly evaporate

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
